name: Peanut Butter And Jelly French Toast

image.caption: Peanut Butter And Jelly French Toast

description: This hearty breakfast is very easy to make - let the kids help!

recipeInstructions.text: Spread peanut butter on six slices of bread; spread jelly on other six slices of bread. Put one slice of each together to form sandwiches.
In mixing bowl, lightly beat eggs; add milk and salt and mix together.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip sandwiches in egg mixture, coating well. Place in skillet and brown both sides. Serve immediately.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Peanut Butter And Jelly French Toast

review.reviewBody: I really didn't care for this.  It was probably my fault since I didn't use the peanut butter...I just used strawberry jelly.  I think I'll just stick with regular PB&J sandwiches, but might give this a try with my youngins.

I just made this for my post-longrun breakfast and it was delicious!  I used natural peanut buter and wholewheat read (like I always do) and Smucker's blackberry preserves-- I think preserves work really ell here, because they're s thick and rich.  I scaled the recipe to make one servng, but I ended uphaving to use twicethe eggsand milk thattherecipe called for-- otherwis there wasn't enough to saturate the bread,so you may want to increase the amount there.  Also,a little cooking spray eliminates the need for butter-- trust me you won't miss it, the peanut butter makes this plenty rich as it is!
I loved it and plan to play around wit it-- maybe peanut butter an marshmallows-- or chocolate!!!

Really good once you get past the taste of warm peanut butter.  As a peanut butter freak, this will easily become a favorite of mine.  I added a splash of vanilla.  Next time I think I'll add some cinnamon too!  Good stuff :)

I really don't like french toast, however, peanut butter can make anything taste fantastic!! I added a little vanilla to the egg mixture and used raspberry jam. Try this with cream cheese and jelly too! Loved it!!!!

Super fun for the whole family to make and VERY yummy! I also added a splash of vanilla to the egg mixture (I use Suttons Bay double strength clear vanilla).  This will probably become a Saturday-morning-must-have-breakfast.
My whole family enjoyed this recipe for breakfast!  To make the batter more of a french toast flavor, add 2 tsp. of vanilla and 1 tsp. of ground cinnamon.  Top with syrup!  Good Stuff!!
